Written by Travis Beacham and featuring cover art by [[Alex Ross]], ''Tales from Year Zero'' serves as an introductory prologue to the film, and is set twelve years before its events.<ref>{{cite web|last=Casey |first=Dan |url=http://www.nerdist.com/2013/03/wondercon-pacific-rim-tales-from-year-zero-alex-ross-cover-revealed/ |title=Wondercon: ''Pacific Rim: Tales From Year Zero'' Alex Ross Cover Revealed « Nerdist |website=Nerdist.com |date=March 30, 2013 |accessdate=May 3, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=PacRim |url=http://pacificrimfilm.blogspot.com/2012/12/merchandising.html |title=Pacific Rim Le film: Merchandising/collectibles |website=Pacificrimfilm.blogspot.com |date=December 24, 2012 |accessdate=May 3, 2013}}</ref> On June 18, Insight Editions published ''Pacific Rim: Man, Machines, and Monsters'', an art book written by David S. Cohen. The book chronicles the film's production with concept art, photography, the cast and crew's accounts of the shoot, and a foreword by del Toro.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/Pacific-Rim-Man-Machines-Monsters/dp/1608871827|title=Pacific Rim: Man, Machines, and Monsters [Hardcover]|website=[[Amazon.com]]|accessdate=August 2, 2013}}</ref> On July 2, a viral video was released in which Ron Perlman's character, Hannibal Chau, advertises his fictional Kaiju organ dealership, Kaiju Remedies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dreadcentral.com/news/68319/ron-perlman-has-your-pacific-rim-kaiju-remedies-right-here|title=Ron Perlman Has Your ''Pacific Rim'' Kaiju Remedies Right Here!|work=dreadcentral.com|date=July 2, 2013|accessdate=July 5, 2013}}</ref>
On the day of the film's release, July 12, 2013, another viral video was released to promote the film. It involved the collaboration of the film studio (including del Toro himself) and the [[YouTube]] network Polaris (also known as The Game Station). It featured members of the YouTube network (such as the ''[[Game Grumps]]'') as Jaeger pilots fighting Kaiju.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Iw8XQ3vdW_4|title=Youtube: Pacific Rim – Training Day|work=[[Maker Studios]]|date=July 12, 2013|accessdate=August 14, 2013}}</ref> On July 16, a novelization by [[Alexander C. Irvine|Alex Irvine]] was released.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/Pacific-Rim-Official-Movie-Novelization/dp/1781166781|title=''Pacific Rim'': The Official Movie Novelization: Alexander Irvine: 9781781166789: Amazon.com: Books|work=amazon.com|accessdate=June 20, 2013}}</ref> [[National Entertainment Collectibles Association|NECA]] began selling [[action figures]] of the film's Kaiju and Jaegers.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pacificrim-movie.net/news/860 |title=Exclusive: First Look at Finished NECA ''Pacific Rim'' Figures! |author=Picard, Chris |website=Scified.com |date=June 7, 2013 |accessdate=July 13, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130712054807/http://www.pacificrim-movie.net/news/860 |archivedate=July 12, 2013 |df= }}</ref>
== Release == ''Pacific Rim'' was initially expected to reach theaters in July 2012. However, Warner Bros. decided to postpone the film's release date to May 10, 2013. In March 2012, it was announced that the film would be released on July 12, 2013.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/schedule/?view=changes&p=.htm | title=Release Schedule – NEW DATES & CHANGES | website=Box Office Mojo | date=March 2012 | accessdate=March 23, 2012}}</ref> The film premiered in [[Mexico City]] on July 1, 2013.<ref>{{cite web|title=A Week In Movies: Pacific Rim Launches|url=http://www.contactmusic.com/round-up/a-week-in-movies-pacific-rim-launches-the-wolverine-shows-himself-and-gwyneth-deals-with-sex-addiction_3747068|date=July 6, 2013|accessdate=October 30, 2013}}</ref>
=== Box office === ''Pacific Rim'' grossed $101.8 million in North America, and has had a favorable international release, grossing $309.2 million in other countries, for a worldwide total of $411,002,906.<ref name="mojo" />
The film grossed $3.6 million from Thursday night showings, 23 percent of which came from IMAX showings. It then faced competition from ''[[Grown Ups 2]]'' and ultimately fell behind it on opening day, earning $14.6 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3701&p=.htm |title=Forecast: 'Pacific Rim' Goes to War With 'Grown Ups 2' This Weekend |website=[[Box Office Mojo]] |date=July 11, 2013 |accessdate=July 21, 2013}}</ref> The film reached the #3 spot during the opening weekend with $37.2 million, behind ''[[Despicable Me 2]]'' and ''Grown Ups 2''. This is the highest-ever opening for a film by del Toro, surpassing ''[[Hellboy II: The Golden Army]]''. Around 50 percent of tickets were in 3D, which makes it the second-highest 3D share of 2013, behind ''[[Gravity (film)|Gravity]]''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/weekend/chart/?yr=2013&wknd=21&p=.htm |title=Weekend Box Office Results for May 24-26, 2013 |website=[[Box Office Mojo]] |accessdate=May 26, 2013}}</ref> During its second weekend, the film dropped a steep 57% with a gross of $16 million, and during its third weekend, had dropped a further 52% with a gross of $7.7 million.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3704&p=.htm |title=Weekend Report: 'Conjuring' Haunts First With Record Opening |date=July 21, 2013 |first=Ray |last=Subers |website=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=July 23, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3706&p=.htm |title=Weekend Report: 'Wolverine' Bleeds, But Still Easily Leads |date=July 28, 2013 |first=Ray |last=Subers |website=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=July 23, 2015}}</ref>
On July 22, 2013, it was reported that the film had reached #1 at the international box office over the weekend.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.deadline.com/2013/07/pacific-rim-1-internationally-over-weekend/|title=''Pacific Rim'' #1 Internationally Over Weekend|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|last=Finke|first=Nikki|authorlink=Nikki Finke|date=July 22, 2013|accessdate=July 23, 2013}}</ref> The film had a successful opening in China, grossing $45.2 million, until overtaken by ''[[The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies]]''<ref name="China">{{cite web | url = http://deadline.com/2015/01/international-box-office-hobbit-five-armies-china-american-sniper-record-eastwood-mortdecai-boy-next-door-results-1201358036/ | title = ‘Hobbit’ Storms China; ‘Sniper’ Takes Out More Records: International Box Office | author = Nancy Tartaglione | publisher = ''[[Deadline Hollywood]]'' | date = January 25, 2015 | accessdate = January 26, 2015}}</ref> the largest opening in China for a Warner Bros. title, and the sixth-largest Chinese debut of all time for any Hollywood film.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/box-office-report-pacific-rim-599329 |title=Box Office Report: ''Pacific Rim'' Scores Massive $45.2 Million China Debut |last=McClintock |first=Pamela |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=August 4, 2013|accessdate=August 4, 2013}}</ref> On August 19, 2013, its gross crossed $100 million in China alone, becoming the sixth-highest-grossing American film ever in China.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/scottmendelson/2013/08/18/weekend-box-office-the-butler-opens-to-25m-kick-ass-2-jobs-paranoia-crash/|title=Weekend Box Office: 'The Butler' Opens To $25m, 'Kick-Ass 2', 'Jobs', And 'Paranoia' Crash |work=[[Forbes]] |date=August 19, 2013|accessdate=August 19, 2013}}</ref> It grossed a total of $114.3 million in the country, making China the largest market for the film.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://english.entgroup.cn/news_detail.aspx?id=2194|title= Hollywood Takes a Hit|author= Bai Shi (Beijing Review)|date= February 9, 2014|accessdate= February 10, 2014|work= english.entgroup.cn|publisher= EntGroup Inc.}}</ref> In Japan, the film landed in the fifth position on opening weekend, with an initial earning of $3 million (behind ''[[World War Z (film)|World War Z]]''{{-'}}s gross of $3.4 million).<ref>{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2013/film/international/pacific-rim-fails-to-wow-japanese-auds-1200577862/ |title=''Pacific Rim'' Fails to Wow Auds |author=Schilling, Mark |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=August 14, 2013 |accessdate=August 14, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/intl/japan/?yr=2013&wk=32&p=.htm/ |title=''Pacific Rim'' Japan Box Office |website=Box Office Mojo |date=August 15, 2013 |accessdate=August 15, 2013}}</ref>
In September 2013, ''[[Forbes]]'' highlighted ''Pacific Rim'' as "the rare English-language film in history to cross $400 million while barely crossing $100 million domestic".<ref name = A/>
=== Critical response === <!-- The "Reception" section of an article is usually reserved for the opinions of professional film critics. Kanye West is not a professional film critic, so his opinion does not belong here. -->
''Pacific Rim'' received generally positive reviews from critics. Review aggregation website [[Metacritic]] gives a rating of 65 out of 100 based on reviews from 48 critics, which indicates "generally favorable reviews".<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.metacritic.com/movie/pacific-rim |title=Pacific Rim Reviews|work=[[Metacritic]] |publisher=[[CBS Interactive]] |accessdate=March 23, 2018}}</ref> The [[review aggregator]] website [[Rotten Tomatoes]] reported a 71% approval rating with an average rating of 6.6/10 based on 272 reviews. The website's critical consensus reads, "It may sport more style than substance, but ''Pacific Rim'' is a solid modern creature feature bolstered by fantastical imagery and an irresistible sense of fun."<ref>{{cite web|title=Pacific Rim (2013)|url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/pacific_rim_2013/|publisher=[[Fandango Media]]|work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|accessdate=June 22, 2018}}</ref>
''[[The Daily Telegraph]]''{{'}}s [[Robbie Collin]] awarded the film five stars out of five, likening the experience of watching it to rediscovering a favorite childhood cartoon. He praised del Toro for investing his own affection for the genre and sense of artistry into the project in such a way that the viewer found themselves immersed in the film rather than watching from afar, noting the director had catered to younger and older audiences alike and expressed surprise that the film could rise above the sum of its parts.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/film/filmreviews/10162332/Pacific-Rim-review.html|title=''Pacific Rim'', review|last=Collin|first=Robbie|work=telegraph.com|date=July 8, 2013|accessdate=July 8, 2013}}</ref> [[Todd McCarthy]] of ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' gave a positive review, describing the film as the sum of the potential every monster film had ever tried to fulfill.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movie/pacific-rim/review/581518|title=''Pacific Rim'': Film Review|work=hollywoodreporter.com|last=McCarthy|first=Todd|authorlink=Todd McCarthy|date=July 7, 2013|accessdate=July 8, 2013}}</ref> [[Lou Lumenick]] of ''[[The New York Post]]'' gave the film four stars out of four, and said it had "no shortage of brains, brawn, eye candy, wit and even some poetry", praising the "clean and coherent" action sequences and the "terrific chemistry" between Hunnam and Kikuchi.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nypost.com/p/entertainment/movies/pacific_rim_baddies_are_big_but_NullCtb04GocGTlszZw83O|title=''Pacific Rim'' baddies are big, but the heroes are better|last=Lumenick|first=Lou|authorlink=Lou Lumenick|date=July 9, 2013|accessdate=July 9, 2013}}</ref> [[Drew McWeeny]] of [[HitFix]] highlighted other aspects of the film, paying particular attention to the production and art design. He also praised the cinematography for "perfectly capturing" the film, and described the score as "ridiculously cool".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hitfix.com/motion-captured/review-guillermo-del-toros-pacific-rim-is-an-eccentric-and-emotional-thrill/|title=Review: Guillermo Del Toro's ''Pacific Rim'' is an eccentric and emotional thrill|last=McWeeny|first=Drew|authorlink=Drew McWeeny|work=hitfix.com|date=July 8, 2013|accessdate=July 8, 2013}}</ref> ''[[Rolling Stone]]''{{'}}s [[Peter Travers]] called the film "the work of a humanist ready to banish cynicism for compassion", saying that del Toro "drives the action with a heartbeat".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/movies/reviews/pacific-rim-20130711|title=Peter Travers' Three-Star Review of ''Pacific Rim''|last=Travers|first=Peter|authorlink=Peter Travers|work=rollingstone.com|date=July 11, 2013|accessdate=July 11, 2013}}</ref> Keith Uhlich of ''[[Time Out (magazine)|Time Out]]'' called the film "pure, pleasurable comic-book absurdity", and noted that del Toro had lent the proceedings a "plausible humanity" lacking in most of summer 2013's destruction-heavy blockbusters. He said the Kaijus' civilian victims make a "palpably personal impression", deeming one scene with Mako Mori "as mythically moving as anything in the mecha anime, like ''[[Neon Genesis Evangelion]]'', that the director emulates with expert aplomb."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.timeout.com/us/film/pacific-rim-movie-review|title=''Pacific Rim'': movie review (PG-13)|last=Uhlich|first=Keith|work=[[Time Out (magazine)|Time Out]] |date=July 8, 2013|accessdate=July 9, 2013}}</ref> ''[[The Village Voice]]''{{'}}s Stephanie Zacharek called it "summer entertainment with a pulse", praising its "dumbly brilliant" action and freedom from elitism, but noted the story is predictable and suggested del Toro's time would be better spent on more visionary films.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.villagevoice.com/2013-07-03/film/del-toro-s-pacific-rim-offers-monster-robot-glory/|title=''Pacific Rim'': Building a Better Blockbuster|work=villagevoice.com|last=Zacharek|first=Stephanie|date=July 8, 2013|accessdate=July 9, 2013}}</ref> Angela Watercutter of ''[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]'' called it the "most awesome movie of the summer", a "fist-pumping, awe-inspiring ride", and opined that its focus on spectacle rather than characterization "simply does not matter" in the summer blockbuster context.<ref name="Wired-Watercutter">{{cite web|url=https://www.wired.com/underwire/2013/07/pacific-rim-surprising-review/all/|title=Pacific Rim Is Literally the Most Awesome Movie of the Summer|last=Watercutter|first=Angela|work=wired.com|date=July 10, 2013|accessdate=July 10, 2013}}</ref> [[Richard Roeper]] gave the film a B, commenting that either the Jaegers or Kaiju "can take down any of the [[Transformers (film series)|Transformers]]."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reelz.com/trailer-clips/70267/pacific-rim-review/ |title=''Pacific Rim'' Review |author=[[Richard Roeper|Roeper, Richard]] |website=[[Reelz (TV channel)|Reelz]] |date=July 12, 2013 |accessdate=July 16, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130716032806/http://www.reelz.com/trailer-clips/70267/pacific-rim-review/ |archivedate=July 16, 2013 |df= }}</ref> [[Leonard Maltin]] gave the film two-and-a-half out of four stars, calling it "three-quarters of a really good movie that doesn't know when to quit."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reelz.com/trailer-clips/70236/pacific-rim-review/ |title=''Pacific Rim'' Review |author=[[Leonard Maltin|Maltin, Leonard]] |website=[[Reelz (TV channel)|Reelz]] |date=July 12, 2013 |accessdate=July 16, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130716070650/http://www.reelz.com/trailer-clips/70236/pacific-rim-review/ |archivedate=July 16, 2013 |df= }}</ref>
''[[The Guardian]]''{{'}}s Andrew Pulver was less enthusiastic, calling the film a mix of "wafer-thin psychodrama" and "plot-generator dialogue".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2013/jul/08/pacific-rim-review-guillermo-del-toro|title=''Pacific Rim'' – review|last=Pulver|first=Andrew|work=guardian.co.uk|date=July 8, 2013|accessdate=July 8, 2013}}</ref> ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]''{{'}}s [[Richard Corliss]] said the action was let down by "inert" drama, describing the film as "45 minutes of awesome encased in 90 minutes of yawnsome."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://entertainment.time.com/2013/07/09/pacific-rim-transformers-transcended/|title=Pacific Rim: Transformers Transcended|work=entertainment.time.com|publisher=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|last=Corliss|first=Richard|authorlink=Richard Corliss|date=July 9, 2013|accessdate=July 10, 2013}}</ref> Justin Chang of ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' criticized it as loud and lacking the nuance and subtlety of del Toro's previous films.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2013/film/reviews/film-review-pacific-rim-1200535260/|title=Film Review: ''Pacific Rim''|last=Chang|first=Justin|work=variety.com|date=July 7, 2013|accessdate=July 8, 2013}}</ref> ''[[The New Yorker]]''{{'}}s Anthony Lane's verdict read as "It is possible to applaud ''Pacific Rim'' for the efficacy of its business model while deploring the tale that has been engendered—long, loud, dark, and very wet. You might as well watch the birth of an elephant."<ref>{{cite journal |url=http://www.newyorker.com/arts/critics/cinema/2013/07/22/130722crci_cinema_lane |title=Grim Tidings |first=Anthony |last=Lane |date=July 22, 2013 |journal=The New Yorker |accessdate=July 23, 2015}}</ref> The ''[[San Francisco Chronicle]]''{{'}}s Mike LaSalle reacted extremely negatively by stating "If this is the best we can do in terms of movies—if something like this can speak to the soul of audiences—maybe we should just turn over the cameras and the equipment to the alien dinosaurs and see what they come up with… Director Guillermo del Toro, who gave us ''[[Pan's Labyrinth]]'' not too many years ago, used to be known as an artistic and discerning filmmaker, despite his affection for blockbuster action and grotesqueness. But too often he gets lost in his computer…Why go to the movies to look at somebody else's computer after looking at your own all week?… The actors can't make ''Pacific Rim'' any better. They can only relieve some of the pain."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sfchronicle.com/entertainment/article/Pacific-Rim-review-Monster-mash-a-washout-4659719.php?t=e4119f1c5c47b02379 |title='Pacific Rim' review: Humans don't deserve to win |first=Mick |last=LaSalle |date=July 11, 2013 |newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle |accessdate=July 23, 2015}}</ref> ''[[Slant Magazine]]''{{'}}s Ed Gonzalez, who said the film lacked poignancy, compared it to a video game: "a stylish but programmatic ride toward an inevitable final boss battle".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slantmagazine.com/film/review/pacific-rim|title=''Pacific Rim'' – Film Review|work=slantmagazine.com|date=July 8, 2013|accessdate=July 9, 2013}}</ref> ''The Wrap''{{'}}s [[Alonso Duralde]] criticized the choice to set most battles at night or during the rain, feeling it detracted from the action, and said the comic relief actors—Day, Gorman, and Perlman—stole the film from the less interesting leads.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thewrap.com/movies/column-post/pacific-rim-review-there-be-monsters-here-somewhere-101501|title=''Pacific Rim'' Review: There Be Monsters in Here Somewhere|work=thewrap.com|last=Duralde|first=Alonso|authorlink=Alonso Duralde|date=July 8, 2013|accessdate=July 9, 2013}}</ref> Jordan Hoffman of [[RealNetworks|Film.com]] identified Hunnam as the weak link in the cast, calling him a "charisma black hole".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.film.com/movies/pacific-rim-review|title=Review: ''Pacific Rim''|last=Hoffman|first=Jordan|work=film.com|date=July 8, 2013|accessdate=July 9, 2013}}</ref> Giles Hardie of ''[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]'' was particularly critical of the film, awarding the action sequences "five [[Intelligence quotient|IQ points]] out of five" as he described the film as an hour and twenty minutes of fight sequences vaguely connected by ten minutes of story.<ref>{{cite news|title=Pacific Rim is an all-action monster with no tale|url=http://www.smh.com.au/entertainment/movies/pacific-rim-is-an-allaction-monster-with-no-tale-20130709-2pnhr.html|first=Giles|last=Hardie|work=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]|date=July 9, 2013|accessdate=July 9, 2013}}</ref>
Director [[Rian Johnson]] praised the film,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://io9.com/5981528/pacific-rim-gets-a-rave-review-from-rian-johnson-plus-some-stunning-new-images|title=''Pacific Rim'' gets a rave review from Rian Johnson, plus some stunning new images|work=io9.com|last=Woerner|first=Meredith|date=February 4, 2013|accessdate=June 30, 2013}}</ref> as did Japanese game director [[Hideo Kojima]], who called it the "ultimate [[otaku]] film" and stated he "never imagined [he] would be fortunate enough to see a film like this in [his] life".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://kotaku.com/hideo-kojima-reviews-pacific-rim-in-eight-tweets-680304164|title=Hideo Kojima Reviews Pacific Rim In Eight Tweets|date=July 5, 2013|accessdate=July 8, 2013}}</ref> [[Go Nagai]], who pioneered the idea of mecha piloted from an interior cockpit, praised the film's fun and intense action, while game developer [[Fumito Ueda]] said its battle scenes surpassed memories of the [[tokusatsu]] films he saw as an impressionable child.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/interest/2013-07-10/metal-gear-shinkawa-draws-pacific-rim-poster-and-japan-creators-laud-film|title=Metal Gear's Shinkawa Draws Pacific Rim Poster & Japan's Creators Laud Film|work=animenewsnetwork.com|date=July 10, 2013|accessdate=July 18, 2013}}</ref> Science fiction author [[William Gibson]] called the film "A ravishing display of intelligent, often wonderfully witty visual design, every frame alive with coherent language, in the service of what is at heart a children's story… A baroque that doesn't curdle, that never fetishizes itself."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tweetlonger.org/getTweet.php?id=9qd|title=Pacific Rim, over 140 characters:|website=tweetlonger.org|last=Gibson|first=William|authorlink=William Gibson|date=July 20, 2013|accessdate=July 21, 2013}}</ref>
The inclusion of only one female character of note resulted in ''Pacific Rim'' not passing the [[Bechdel test]]. This became a topic of discussion in the media and on the Internet. Opinions were divided between those pointing to the film as an example of Hollywood's practice of ostracizing women, and those noting that the film did not [[Sexual objectification|sexually objectify]] Mako Mori and gave her a narrative arc not revolving around a man.<ref name="The Daily Dot 18 August 2013">{{cite news|last=Romano|first=Aja|title=The Mako Mori Test: 'Pacific Rim' inspires a Bechdel Test alternative|url=http://www.dailydot.com/fandom/mako-mori-test-bechdel-pacific-rim/|accessdate=September 15, 2013|newspaper=[[The Daily Dot]]|date=August 18, 2013}}</ref><ref name="Metro 18 July 2013">{{cite news|last=McGuinness|first=Ross|title=The Bechdel test and why Hollywood is a man’s, man’s, man’s world|url=http://metro.co.uk/2013/07/18/movie-lovers-hit-back-at-hollywood-misogyny-with-the-bechdel-test-3886103/|accessdate=September 15, 2013|newspaper=[[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]]|date=July 18, 2013}}</ref>
=== Accolades === {| class="wikitable" |- ! Award !! Category !! Winner/Nominee !! Result |- | [[American Black Film Festival|ABFF Hollywood Awards]] | Artist of the Year | [[Idris Elba]] (also for ''[[Mandela: Long Walk to Freedom]]'' and ''[[Thor: The Dark World]]'') | {{nominated}} |- | rowspan=2| [[Annie Award]] | Outstanding Achievement, Animated Effects in a Live Action Production | | {{won}} |- |Outstanding Achievement, Character Animation in a Live Action Production | | {{nominated}} |- |[[British Academy Film Awards]] |[[BAFTA Award for Best Special Visual Effects|Best Special Visual Effects]] | | {{nom}} |- | [[Critics' Choice Movie Award]] | [[Broadcast Film Critics Association Award for Best Visual Effects|Best Visual Effects]] | | {{nominated}} |- | Denver Film Critics Society | Best Science Fiction/Horror Film | | {{nominated}} |- | [[Empire Awards]] | Best Sci-Fi/Fantasy | | {{nominated}} |- |Hollywood Film Awards |Best Visual Effects |John Knoll |{{won}} |- | Las Vegas Film Critics Society | Best Horror/Sci-Fi Film | |{{won}} |- |rowspan="5"|[[Saturn Award]] | [[Saturn Award for Best Science Fiction Film|Best Science Fiction Film]] | |{{nom}} |- | [[Saturn Award for Best Director|Best Director]] | [[Guillermo del Toro]] |{{nom}} |- | Best Production Design | Andrew Neskoromny and [[Carol Spier]] |{{nom}} |- | [[Saturn Award for Best Editing|Best Editing]] | Peter Amundson and John Gilroy |{{nom}} |- | [[Saturn Award for Best Special Effects|Best Special Effects]] | John Knoll, James E. Price, Clay Pinney and Rocco Larizza |{{nom}} |- |[[St. Louis Gateway Film Critics Association]] |Best Visual Special Effects |John Knoll |{{nom}} |- |[[Teen Choice Awards]] |Summer Movie Action | |{{nom}} |- |rowspan=5|[[Visual Effects Society]] |Outstanding Visual Effects in a Visual Effects-Driven Feature Motion Picture |John Knoll, Susan Greenhow, Chris Raimo, Hal Hickel |{{nom}} |- |Outstanding Animated Character in a Live Action Feature Motion Picture |Jakub Pistecky, Frank Gravatt, Cyrus Jam, Chris Havreberg for Kaiju - Leatherback |{{nom}} |- |Outstanding Created Environment in a Live Action Feature Motion Picture |Johan Thorngren, Jeremy Bloch, David Meny, Polly Ing for "Virtual Hong Kong" |{{nom}} |- |Outstanding Virtual Cinematography in a Live Action Feature Motion Picture |Colin Benoit, Nick Walker, Adam Schnitzer, Victor Schutz for "Hong Kong Ocean Brawl" |{{nom}} |- |Outstanding Models in a Feature Motion Picture |David Fogler, Alex Jaeger, Aaron Wilson, David Behrens |{{nom}} |}
=== Home media === ''Pacific Rim'' became available for download on the [[iTunes Store]] and [[Vudu]] on October 1, 2013.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://blog.vudu.com/?p=10164 |title=New Releases for the Week of Oct 1 |website=vudu.com |date=October 2, 2013 |accessdate=October 10, 2013}}</ref> The film was released on DVD and [[Blu-ray]] Disc in the US on October 15, 2013, and in the UK and other countries on November 25, 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pacificrim-movie.net/news/1152 |title=Own Pacific Rim on BluRay and DvD October 15th! |author=Picard, Chris |website=Scified.com |date=September 5, 2013 |accessdate=September 6, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130907064407/http://www.pacificrim-movie.net/news/1152 |archivedate=September 7, 2013 |df= }}</ref> A collector's edition was also available on the same date.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00F0N7JUG |title=Pacific Rim Collector's Edition (Blu-ray 3D + Blu-ray + DVD +UltraViolet Combo Pack) (2013)}}</ref> To help promote the home media release, Bryan Harley and Roque Rodriguez of [[Fresno, California]], produced a "[[sweded]]" version of the film's ''Gipsy Danger'' vs. Otachi battle scene, after del Toro was impressed by the duo's "sweded" trailer released on YouTube in March 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fresnobee.com/2013/10/14/3553287/cheap-shots.html |title=Fresno Swede Fest founders help pitch 'Pacific Rim' DVD |author=Tehee, Joshua |work=The Fresno Bee |date=October 15, 2013 |accessdate=October 16, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131015165927/http://www.fresnobee.com/2013/10/14/3553287/cheap-shots.html |archivedate=October 15, 2013 |df= }}</ref> As of March 2014, Pacific Rim has sold 961,845 DVDs along with 1,427,692 Blu-ray Discs in the United States for $10,045,530 and $24,634,992 in revenue, respectively, for a total of $37,079,122.<ref>[http://www.the-numbers.com/movie/Pacific-Rim#tab=video-sales Pacific Rim - Box Office Data, DVD and Blu-ray Sales, Movie News, Cast and Crew Information]. ''The Numbers''. Retrieved on June 5, 2014.</ref> Pacific Rim was released on 4K UHD Blu-Ray on October 4 2016.<ref>{{Citation|title=Pacific Rim 4K Blu-ray|url=http://www.blu-ray.com/movies/Pacific-Rim-4K-Blu-ray/151129/|accessdate=2018-06-14}}</ref>
== Sequel == {{main|Pacific Rim Uprising}} A sequel titled ''Pacific Rim Uprising'' was released on March 23, 2018.
