{{Infobox person | name = Terese Nielsen | image = | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1966|03|11}} | birth_place = [[Aurora, Nebraska]], U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | education = [[Art Center College of Design]] | occupation = Artist | spouse = | parents = | children = }}
'''Terese Nielsen''' (born March 11, 1966)<ref name=SFE/> is an American freelance [[fantasy]] artist and illustrator.
==Early life, education, and family== Nielsen was born in [[Aurora, Nebraska]], in 1966.<ref name=SFE/> Nielsen's brother, [[Ron Spencer]], is also an artist.<ref name="tnielsenbio"/>
In 1984 Nielsen followed her brother and relocated to [[Rexburg, Idaho]], where they studied art at [[Ricks College]].<ref name="tnielsenbio"/> Upon completing her studies there, she studied at the Art Center College of Design (ACCD) in [[Pasadena, California]], graduating with "great distinction" in 1991.<ref name="tnielsenbio">{{cite web |title=Bio |url= http://tnielsen.com/Bio.html |date=November 3, 2014 |website=tnielsen.com |publisher=Hidden Kingdom |accessdate=November 3, 2014}}</ref><ref name="wizardsbio">{{cite web |title= Author/Artist Bios: Terese Nielsen |website= wizards.com| url= http://ww2.wizards.com/Books/Wizards/Bios/default.aspx?doc=nielsenterese |date=2009 |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090224012640/http://ww2.wizards.com/Books/Wizards/Bios/default.aspx?doc=nielsenterese |publisher=Wizards of the Coast |archivedate=February 24, 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Felt|first=Kevin|title=Painter of 'Magic' cards inspiring random acts of kindness|newspaper=[[San Gabriel Valley Tribune]]|date=November 17, 2007}}</ref>
She married [[Cliff Nielsen]], another ACCD graduate, and they illustrated ''[[Ruins (comics)|Ruins]]'' (1995); they have since divorced.<ref name=SFE/> She has four children and resides in [[Temple City, California]], with her wife.<ref name="tnielsenbio"/><ref name= brown>{{cite interview | url= http://krcu.org/post/interview-artist-terese-nielsen#stream/0| website= [[KCRU|krcu]].org| first= Terese| last= Nielsen| title= An Interview With Artist Terese Nielsen| interviewer= Jason Brown | date= December 1, 2016| publisher= | access-date= July 5, 2018}}</ref>
==Career== [[Landmark Entertainment]] hired Nielsen to help design its themed [[amusement park]]s, and [[DC Comics|DC]] and [[Marvel Comics]] hired her to illustrate several [[superhero]] [[trading card]]s.<ref name="wizardsbio"/> She illustrated Marvel graphic novels, one of which was ''[[Ruins (comics)|Ruins]]'', which she did with her then husband, [[Cliff Nielsen]].<ref name="tnielsenbio"/> For [[Topps Comics|Topps]] she painted several ''[[Xena: Warrior Princess (comics)|Xena]]'' covers, as well as ''[[Star Wars comics#Dark Horse|Star Wars]]'' covers for [[Dark Horse Comics|Dark Horse]].<ref name="wizardsbio"/>
Nielsen illustrated the graphic novella that was included as part of the 1993 video game ''[[Gabriel Knight: Sins of the Fathers]]''. In a favorable review, Scott A. May wrote, "Nielsen's dark, disturbing visions carry over to many of the game's hand painted back-drops, drawn from a gloomy palette of deep red, blue, and black."<ref>{{Cite journal | last1 = May | first1 = Scott A. | year = 1994 | title = Entertainment choice—Gabriel Knight: Sins of the Fathers | url = | journal = [[Compute!]] | volume = 16 | issue = 6| pages = 88–9 }}</ref> In the video game genre, her influence can be seen in [[Sierra Entertainment|Sierra]]'s ''[[Gabriel Knight]]'' series, and in her work for [[The 3DO Company|3DO]]'s ''[[Meridian 59]]'', and she worked with [[Mythic Entertainment]] creating the look for the advertising campaign promoting the interactive internet game ''[[Dark Age of Camelot]]''.<ref name="wizardsbio"/>
She began working for [[Wizards of the Coast]] in 1996.<ref name="wizardsbio"/> Nielsen has gained a fan following mainly because of her illustrations for the [[trading card game]] [[Magic: The Gathering]].<ref>Ednalino, Percy (September 4, 2000). "And tattoos, too: 'New school' artists versatile", ''[[The Denver Post]]'', p. G1.</ref> Nielsen has produced art for both Magic and Wizards of the Coast's other products since 1996, in addition to her work as an illustrator of book covers & interiors and movie posters. She has served as a juror for the [[Spectrum Award]]s.<ref>{{cite journal| date= May 2002| title= 9th Spectrum Art Awards| work= Science Fiction Chronicle| volume= 23| number= 5| pages= 6–7}}</ref> She created several images for the [[Harry Potter Trading Card Game]], released in 2001.<ref name="wizardsbio"/>
In reviewing her work "Savant" in the ''Wildstorm Gallery'' collection released in 1996, critic Joseph Szadkowski wrote, "Imagine British artist Dante Gabriel Rossetti tickled into a mood by a Sex Pistols album to fully appreciate the Nielsen style."<ref>Szadkowski, Joseph (April 27, 1996). "Artistry at a low price: Masterfully drawn 90-card collection leads the pack", ''[[The Washington Times]]'', p. B4.</ref> Szadkowski also praised Nielsen's work in the Marvel Comics ''Code of Honor'' series (1997).<ref>Szadkowski, Joseph (April 19, 1997). "Nazis, Daemonites and X-Men", ''[[The Washington Times]]'', p. B4.</ref>
She created the look for the ''Sembia'' series of Forgotten Realms novels, and for [[Greg Keyes]]' ''[[The Age of Unreason|Age of Unreason]]'' series published by [[Del Rey Books|Del Rey]].<ref name="wizardsbio"/> Endorsed by Lucas, she was involved in several Star Wars pieces for ''The New Jedi Order'', also published by Del Rey.<ref name= "wizardsbio"/> Nielsen did the cover artwork for the ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'' settings ''Jakandor, Land of Legend'' and ''Jakandor, Isle of Destiny'' in 1998 and illustrated the covers of three issues of ''[[Dragon (magazine)|Dragon]]''.
In 1999 the [[Alderac Entertainment Group]] published the ''Gamemasters' guide'' for the ''[[7th Sea (role-playing game)|7th Sea]]'' role-playing game, with all art covers since then (main guides and supplements) primarily painted by Nielsen. Also in 1999, she received a nomination for a [[Chesley Award]] for Best Gaming-Related Illustration for her illustration of the Magic: The Gathering card "Ertai, Wizard Adept".<ref>{{cite journal| date= April–May 1999| title= Chesley Award nominations| work= Science Fiction Chronicle| volume= 20| number= 5| page= 5}}</ref>
Nielsen was a [[Gen Con]] artist guest of honor in 2014.<ref name="gencon2014">{{cite web |title=Aritist [''sic''] Guest of Honor |url=http://www.gencon.com/experience/artistgoh |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20140625070214/http://gencon.com/experience/artistgoh |website= gencon.com | publisher= Gen Con LLC| date= 2014| archivedate= June 25, 2014}}</ref>
Nielsen has contributed art to ''[[Hearthstone: Heroes of Warcraft]]''.
==References== {{Reflist |25em |refs=
<ref name=SFE> [http://www.sf-encyclopedia.com/nielsen_terese "Nielsen, Terese"]{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}. Revised January 21, 2013. ''[[The Encyclopedia of Science Fiction]]'' (sf-encyclopedia.com). Retrieved 2014-12-20. Entry by 'GW', [[Gary Westfahl]].</ref>
}}
==External links== * {{official website |tnielsen.com }} * {{cite web |url=http://www.pen-paper.net/rpgdb.php?op=showcreator&creatorid=428 |archive-date=September 30, 2007 |title=Pen & Paper RPG Database listing for Terese Nielsen |dead-url=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070930204753/http://www.pen-paper.net/rpgdb.php?op=showcreator&creatorid=428 |df= }} <!-- * {{LCAuth|no97008698|Terese Nielsen|0|}} 2014-12-20, not yet any biographical data or catalog records -->

page.title: The Only Fools and Horses DVD Collection

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} {{multiple issues|{{Notability|Products|date=September 2011}} {{unreferenced|date=September 2011}} {{advert|date=September 2011}} }} {{Infobox magazine | title = The Only Fools and Horses DVD Collection | italic title = no | image_file = | image_size = | image_alt = | image_caption = | editor = Laura Eagleton
Hillary Steadman | editor_title = Editor | previous_editor = | staff_writer = Anna Moore
Rachel Nash
Lucy Hatherall
Liz Holland
Jen Banks
Richard Mead
Sarah Ellis | frequency = Fortnightly | circulation = | category = [[Television]] | company = [http://www.gefabbri.co.uk/ GE Fabbri] | publisher = | firstdate = September 2005 | finaldate = October 2006 (30 issues) | country = United Kingdom | based = | language = English | website = | issn = 1743-2065 }} '''''The Only Fools and Horses DVD Collection''''' was a fortnightly [[partwork]] [[magazine]] published by [[GE Fabbri]], authorised by [[BBC Video]]. Each serialised issue included a DVD containing between 1 and 4 chronological episodes of ''[[Only Fools and Horses]]'', and an accompanying magazine. Each issue was £7.99, apart from issue 1 which was £3.99. In total 29 regular issues were released, as well as a 'bonus disc' which featured the documentary 'The Story of Only Fools and Horses'. ==Issues== #"[[Big Brother (Only Fools and Horses)|Big Brother]]", "[[Go West Young Man (Only Fools and Horses)|Go West Young Man]]" and "[[Cash and Curry]]" #"[[The Second Time Around (Only Fools and Horses)|The Second Time Around]]", "[[A Slow Bus To Chingford]]" and "[[The Russians Are Coming]]" #"[[Christmas Crackers (Only Fools and Horses)|Christmas Crackers]]", "[[The Long Legs of the Law]]", "[[Ashes to Ashes (Only Fools and Horses)|Ashes to Ashes]]" and "[[A Losing Streak]]" #"[[No Greater Love (Only Fools and Horses)|No Greater Love]]", "[[The Yellow Peril]]" and "[[It Never Rains...]]" #"[[A Touch of Glass]]", "[[Diamonds Are for Heather]]" and "[[Homesick (Only Fools and Horses)|Homesick]]" #"[[Healthy Competition]]", "[[Friday the 14th]]" and "[[Yesterday Never Comes]]" #"[[May The Force Be With You (Only Fools and Horses)|May The Force Be With You]]", "[[Wanted (Only Fools and Horses)|Wanted]]", "[[Who's a Pretty Boy?]]" and "[[Thicker than Water (Only Fools and Horses)|Thicker than Water]]" #"[[Happy Returns]]", "[[Strained Relations]]" and "[[Hole in One (Only Fools and Horses)|Hole in One]]" #"[[It's Only Rock and Roll (Only Fools and Horses)|It's Only Rock and Roll]]", "[[Sleeping Dogs Lie (Only Fools and Horses)|Sleeping Dogs Lie]]", "[[Watching the Girls Go By]]" and "[[As One Door Closes]]" #"[[To Hull and Back]]" #"[[From Prussia With Love]]", "[[The Miracle of Peckham]]", "[[The Longest Night (Only Fools and Horses)|The Longest Night]]" #"[[Tea for Three]]", "[[Video Nasty (Only Fools and Horses)|Video Nasty]]" and "[[Who Wants to Be a Millionaire (Only Fools and Horses)|Who Wants to Be a Millionaire]]" #"[[A Royal Flush]]" and "[[The Frog's Legacy]]" #"[[Dates (Only Fools and Horses)|Dates]]" #"[[Yuppy Love]]" and "[[Danger UXD]]" #"[[Chain Gang (Only Fools and Horses)|Chain Gang]]" and "[[The Unlucky Winner Is...]]" #"[[Sickness and Wealth]]" and "[[Little Problems]]" #"[[The Jolly Boys' Outing]]" #"[[Rodney Come Home]]" #"[[The Sky's the Limit (Only Fools and Horses)|The Sky's the Limit]]" and "[[The Chance of a Lunchtime]]" #"[[Stage Fright (Only Fools and Horses)|Stage Fright]]" and "[[The Class of '62]]" #"[[He Ain't Heavy, He's My Uncle]]" and "[[Three Men, a Woman and a Baby]]" #"[[Miami Twice]]" #"[[Mother Nature's Son (Only Fools and Horses)|Mother Nature's Son]]" #"[[Fatal Extraction]]" #"[[Heroes and Villains (Only Fools and Horses)|Heroes and Villains]]", "[[Modern Men (Only Fools and Horses)|Modern Men]]" and "[[Time On Our Hands]]" #"[[If They Could See Us Now]]" #"[[Strangers on the Shore]]" #"[[Sleepless in Peckham]]" Bonus disc: "The Story of Only Fools and Horses" (documentary) ==Magazines== Each DVD came with a magazine, focused primarily on the episodes in the accompanying DVD. Some features recurred across all/most of the issues: *'''Episode Guides:''' These provided a description of the episodes included on the DVD and a section entitled ''straight from the horse's mouth'' where series writer [[John Sullivan (writer)|John Sullivan]] explained the roots of the episode. Each guide would have a ''Del's lingo'', where one of [[Del Boy|the character]]'s foreign phrases was translated to his intended meaning; and a ''Rodders rant'' which saw a description of the episodes' events from the perspective of [[Rodney Trotter|the youngest Trotter brother]]. *'''Peckham Profiles:''' This featured a spotlight on a different character from the show each issue. This included a section called ''straight from the horse's mouth'', where John Sullivan talked about the creation of the character and how the actor who played him/her was chosen. The final section of this feature was called ''The Secret World of...'', which listed several facts about the character in bullet points. A lot of the characters featured in two 'Peckham Profiles' over the course of the collection, with content split between their earlier and later years. *'''Classic Clips:''' A description of one of the most memorable scenes, with episode stills and a commentary from John Sullivan. *'''Hooky Street:''' A description of items that Del bought, owned, sold or talked about throughout the course of the show. *'''Behind the Scenes:''' A insight into things or people associated with the production of ''Only Fools and Horses'', explaining how they became involved in the programme. *'''The World According to:''' These articles would feature a discussion of a theme or topic that occurred in the series, from the perspective of one of the characters. ==DVD Spine== When all the DVD spines were lined up they formed a picture of the regular characters. From left to right: {{flatlist| * [[List of Only Fools and Horses characters#Other regular characters|Mickey Pearce]] * [[Trigger (Only Fools and Horses)|Trigger]] * [[Uncle Albert]] * [[Grandad (Only Fools and Horses)|Grandad]] * [[Rodney Trotter]] * [[Del Boy|Derek Trotter]] * [[Boycie]] * [[Mike Fisher (Only Fools and Horses)|Mike Fisher]] * [[Denzil Tulser]] * [[Damien Trotter]] * [[Raquel Turner]] * [[Cassandra Trotter]] }} ==See also== *[[Only Fools and Horses DVDs]] *[[List of Only Fools and Horses episodes]] ==External links== *[http://www.gefabbri.co.uk/publication.php?title=onlyfoolsandhorses GE Fabbri page] {{Only Fools and Horses}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Only Fools and Horses DVD Collection}} [[Category:Only Fools and Horses|DVD Collection]] [[Category:Television videos and DVDs]] [[Category:Partworks]]

Dan Liu | location =Los Angeles, U.S.A. | cinematography = [[Michael Fimognari]] | runtime = 24:08 minutes (Total) | company = | distributor = | network = [[AMC Networks|AMC.com]] | first_aired = {{Start date|2012|10|01}} | website = http://www.amc.com/shows/the-walking-dead/video-extras/cold-storage-webisodes | website_title = ''Cold Storage'' at AMC.com | image_size = 250 | screenplay = | story = }} '''''The Walking Dead: Cold Storage''''' is a four-part [[web series]] based on the television series ''[[The Walking Dead (TV series)|The Walking Dead]]''. It aired in its entirety on October 1, 2012, on [[AMC (TV channel)|AMC]]'s official website, two weeks before the premiere of the [[The Walking Dead (season 3)|third season]] of the show. The web series follows the story of a young man named Chase as he seeks shelter in a storage facility commanded by a malicious employee named B.J.{{cite press|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2012/10/01/the-walking-dead-new-webisodes-launch-on-amctv-com-on-monday-october-1/150796/|title='The Walking Dead' New Webisodes Launch on AMCTV.com on Monday, October 1|first=Sara|last=Bibel|publisher=[[Tribune Digital Ventures]]|work=[[TV by the Numbers]]|date=October 1, 2012|accessdate=September 20, 2015}}{{Cite web|url=http://blogs.amctv.com/the-walking-dead/2012/10/season-3-webisodes.php|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121002223953/http://blogs.amctv.com/the-walking-dead/2012/10/season-3-webisodes.php|archivedate=October 2, 2012|title=''The Walking Dead – Cold Storage'' Webisodes Now Online|publisher=AMCtv.com|last=Neuman|first=Clayton|date=October 1, 2012|accessdate=September 20, 2015}} This web series marks a second installment, following ''[[The Walking Dead: Torn Apart]]'', which aired a year earlier.{{cite press|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2011/09/27/amc-launches-the-walking-dead-webisodes-on-monday-october-3-at-2-pm-801410/20110927amc01/|title=AMC Launches "The Walking Dead" Webisodes on Monday, October 3 at 2 PM|publisher=Futon Media|work=[[The Futon Critic]]|date=September 27, 2011|accessdate=October 14, 2012}} == Synopsis == Chase ([[Josh Stewart]]) is portrayed as a survivor seeking refuge on a rooftop near Atlanta, Georgia. Despite his intention to reunite with his sister (who is referenced to be in a separate caravan), Chase and companion Harris (Chris Nelson) decide to investigate a nearby storage facility. The two are quickly swarmed by walkers and Harris is killed in the attack, but Chase manages to escape, unharmed, to one of the storage units. It is revealed that the storage units are under the sole command of a former employee named B.J., who is initially hostile to Chase. B.J. changes his mind after Chase offers to restore a damaged basement generator in exchange for one of B.J's [[box truck]]s. Chase takes some clothes from a storage unit which also contains family photo albums indicating it belonged to [[Rick Grimes]]. After a nonchalant B.J. fails to mention the presence of walkers in the basement, Chase's suspicions are raised. Chase's suspicions are confirmed when B.J. shows Chase a pile of dead bodies and mercilessly fires a shot at Chase, who collapses into the pile of bodies, apparently dead. Chase survives the shooting with only a graze to his temple and returns to the compound to take revenge. He inadvertently finds Kelly (a female employee B.J. claimed had called in sick the day "shit hit the fan"), who explains that B.J. murdered the other employees and forced her into [[sexual slavery]]. B.J., realizing the situation, confronts Kelly and her liberator, refusing to let Chase leave with her. The events of this standoff culminate in B.J.'s decapitation (presumably by Kelly) while the two survivors escape the compound in a box truck (implied to be low on gas). B.J.'s zombified head is shown on a table watching the surveillance monitors as the compound is overrun by walkers. == Cast == * [[Josh Stewart]] as Chase * [[Daniel Roebuck]] as B.J. * [[Cerina Vincent]] as Kelly * Chris Nelson as Harris == Crew == * Director: [[Greg Nicotero]] * Writer: John Esposito * Producer: Sarah J. Donahue * Executive producers: Michael Petok, Chris Pollack, and Jared Hoffman * Composer: Kevin Blumenfeld * Cinematography: Jonathan Hall * Editors: Julius Ramsay and Dan Liu * Production designer: Brett Snodgrass * Art direction: Jenna Sanders * Costume designer: Bonnie Stauch ==Webisodes== {{Episode table |background=#363636 |overall=6 |title=28 |director=16 |writer=27 |airdate=14 |aux4=9 |aux4T=Running time |released=y|episodes= {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber=1 |Title=Hide and Seek |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2012|10|1}} |DirectedBy=[[Greg Nicotero]] |WrittenBy=John Esposito |Aux4=4:29 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber=2 |Title=Keys to the Kingdom |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2012|10|1}} |DirectedBy=Greg Nicotero |WrittenBy=John Esposito |Aux4=4:57 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber=3 |Title=The Chosen Ones |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2012|10|1}} |DirectedBy=Greg Nicotero |WrittenBy=John Esposito |Aux4=5:38 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber=4 |Title=Parting Shots |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2012|10|1}} |DirectedBy=Greg Nicotero |WrittenBy=John Esposito |Aux4=9:04 }} }} == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == {{Portal|Horror fiction}} * {{Official website|http://www.amc.com/shows/the-walking-dead/video-extras/cold-storage-webisodes}} * [https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2022190/ ''The Walking Dead: Cold Storage''] at the [[Internet Movie Database]] {{The Walking Dead}} {{The Walking Dead episodes}} {{Streamy Awards Winners CSS}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Walking Dead Cold Storage}} [[Category:The Walking Dead|Cold Storage]] [[Category:Prequel television series]] [[Category:Drama web series]] [[Category:Horror fiction web series]] [[Category:American web series]] [[Category:Streamy Award-winning channels, series or shows]]
